part2.question:
Describe an occasion when you lost your way. You should say:
Where you were
What happened
How you felt
And explain how you found your way.
part2.model_answer: I am a huge fan of basketball, which is a thrilling and fast-paced game. It requires great Stamina [耐力] and skill from the players. Since I play it at school, I know how hard it is, although pros make it look easy. Watching a match gives me an Adrenaline [肾上腺素] rush. I admire the Agility [敏捷] of the athletes on the court. It is a Competitive [竞争的] sport that teaches Teamwork [团队合作]. I often do a Workout [锻炼] to improve my own skills. It requires Endurance [忍耐力] to run for the whole game. It is a great Recreation [娱乐] for students.

And explain how you felt about the situation.
part2.model_answer: I make an effort to go jogging every evening in the park near my home. It builds my Stamina [耐力] and clears my mind after a long day of study. Even though I sometimes feel lazy, I force myself to run because it improves my Endurance [忍耐力] significantly. It is a simple Workout [锻炼] that needs no expensive equipment. I enjoy the fresh air and Recreation [娱乐] time alone. It helps maintain my Agility [敏捷] and overall health. It is not very Competitive [竞争的], just personal. I get an Adrenaline [肾上腺素] boost when I sprint at the end. Teamwork [团队合作] is not needed here, just focus.
